intro: Gayophytum diffusum subsp. diffusum, commonly known as the broadleaf gayophytum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
